item.title: Analytics Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Lead

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture/Enterprise Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.
  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must have

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Data Science, Consulting).
  • Fluent in SQL (for analyses & creating reports) and predictive analytics in R or Python. 
  • Experience communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners.
  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in improving business processes using ML is a big plus.
  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a plus.
  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

RBC Ventures

 #LI-Hybrid

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

item.title: Vice President Quantitative Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Vice President Quantitative Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Vice President in Quantitative Analytics, you will be working in a fast-paced, active trading environment with front office deadlines. You will join the Quant team to develop new and improve existing Credit Derivatives valuation and risk management models and create analysis tools for the trading desk. You will work closely with multiple stakeholders like Trading and Sales, Structuring, Global Market Risk and Technology.  

What will you do?

  • Research, develop and implement mathematical models to calculate the value and risk of Credit products (cash and derivative);
  • Improve existing pricing models, tools and operational frameworks;
  • Support ad-hoc requests for quantitative tools and analysis from the Global Spread Products trading and sales desks;
  • Document products and models;
  • Work closely with risk and control functions to achieve and maintain formal validation of models for official reporting.

What do you need to succeed?

  • Post-graduate degree in a quantitative area such as mathematics, physics, finance, engineering or computer science;
  • At least 4 years of experience providing quantitative support to trading desks.
  • Knowledge of Credit Derivatives products;
  • Strong numerical and analytical programming skills in C++;
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • The ability to approach novel problems systematically and with tenacity. 

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

As a Vice President in Quantitative Analytics, you will be working in a fast-paced, active trading environment with front office deadlines. You will join the Quant team to develop new and improve existing Credit Derivatives valuation and risk management models and create analysis tools for the trading desk. You will work closely with multiple stakeholders like Trading and Sales, Structuring, Global Market Risk and Technology.

item.title: Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will have the opportunity to apply analytics to the point of client interaction with the Digital Products of RBC.  You will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle: data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations. 

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure and complete analyses, uncover insights, develop net new data assets, and build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 5+ years of experience in related digital product development, data analyst or data mining role
  • Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm for advancing digital analytics and products
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala and PowerPoint
  • Experience with Jupyter Notebooks, Google Analytics, Data Studio, Tableau or comparable data visualization tools
  • Hands-on knowledge of agile methodologies Github and JIRA
  • Structured thinking: developing an end-to-end analysis plans to tackle ambiguous and open-ended business problems
  • Stakeholder management skills: ability to inform and influence stakeholders through data, build relationships, communicate early and often
  • High agency: figuring out a way to get the job done, pushing through in the face of imperfect conditions or managing to reverse adverse conditions to achieve goals

Nice-to-have

  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Design, oversee and deliver analytics on client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use data mining and a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights
    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support product development strategies and drive decisions
    • Help implement re-usable analytics frameworks for use across Digital data
  • Data Collection/ Ingestions/ Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
  • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
  • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities
  • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Actively support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Manage stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with progress on deliverables
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Senior Manager, Text Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Text Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Senior Manager, Text Analytics role within the CRM Analytics team. In this role, you will work closely with members of CRM Analytics and collaborate with various partners including Information Technology, Product groups and Marketing partners across Personal and Commercial Banking focusing on text analytics developing and implementing solutions that deliver value-added and insightful information to assist in driving business profitability and enhancing customer experience.

What will you do?

  • Perform text analytics on call centre transcriptions and other text data supporting the Lines of Business in meeting their financial and strategic imperatives and providing value for clients
  • Research, develop, deploy and maintain end-to-end NLP and machine learning solutions to serve business and client needs
  • Generate pertinent marketing leads and collaborate with partners to drive campaign executions
  • Automate and scale data management and strategy application processes
  • Develop and enhance infrastructure to integrate and ingest the latest data
  • Provide analytical support for other functions within the CRM Analytics team developing and presenting insights and recommendations to continuously improve on current client-centric strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Expert skill in Python; proficient skill in SAS and SQL
  • Demonstrated experience with text analytics and statistical model development
  • Proficient in Linux environment, shell scripting and Git
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.title: Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

In this role as a Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics, you will leverage analytics skills, design and implement data science solutions to solve a broad range of marketing business use cases related to marketing spend optimization. By collaborating with business, marketing, analytics & technology partners, you will take full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights and opportunities that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Our vision is to improve the way we measure marketing investments, and to help the organization evolve the decisioning and planning strategy for marketing mix.

What will you do?

  • Develop RBC Marketing Mix Modelling strategy, scaling resources, tools, and processes to provide solutions that align to business needs that are actionable with a tangible outcome. Work closely with key marketing and business partners and influence key stakeholders.
  • Collect and validate data from various sources, and prepare structured/non-structured data for modelling by cleaning, integrating and transforming large datasets
  • Develop and deploy statistical and machine learning models using Python and R
  • Translate model outputs and leverage visualization tools/packages to story-tell and convey data-driven insights with actionable recommendations to key stakeholders
  • Research, explore, and prototype future non-standard analytics approaches that push the current limits by quickly learning emerging methods/tools from research communities and further exploring public and vendor data

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or other quantitative discipline
  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics and statistical modelling with a focus on driving business impact
  • Strong Python/R skills for model preparation and development
  • Proficiency with SQL is required and experience working with cloud environments would be a plus
  • Familiarity with scenario planning for optimization or forecasting
  • Experience of visualizing and presenting data and analytics findings to executives
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and communication skills
  • Self-motivation, creativity and ability to work independently


 

Nice to have:

  • Previous experience with marketing and media analytics, including attribution and marketing mix modelling
  • Familiarity with marketing metrics and analyzing data for digital marketing as well as all other non-digital channel marketing
  • Experience working in financial industry with understanding of bank products and data
  • Experience with natural language processing / text mining or competitive market analysis

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.title: Senior Manager, ALM Research & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, ALM Research & Analytics

Job Description

  • Research, methodology and model development relating to structural interest rate risk measurement methodologies, consumer behaviour econometric modeling and forecasting (prepayment, redemption, pull through), interest rate economic capital, and retail product and embedded option pricing models for CAD and US retail and business banking balance sheets and products.  Model and balance sheet set-up.
  • Pricing/valuation and risk measurement model development and calibration, development of diffusion, historic simulation, factor models, and deposit rate index models in support of pricing/valuation and risk measurement including economic capital, economic value and net interest income risk management.
  • A detailed understanding of balance sheet dynamics including product characteristics, consumer behaviour and anticipation of product flows, term preference and retail product mix is required. 
  • Development and implementation of analytical capabilities enhancing the organization’s understanding of the interaction of net interest revenue and interest rate, credit, and liquidity risks.
  • This role supports stakeholder communications related to awareness/understanding of non-trading risk and risk measurement methodologies and documentation of the methodologies and associated risk models for model validation purpose.
  • Research and implement risk methodology and model development relating to DB Pension risk measurement.  Identify and assess risk and return opportunities combining a diverse mix of pension asset classes and strategies including global and domestic fixed income, equities and alternatives, (hedge funds, private equity and infrastructure). 

Must Have

  • Graduate degree in economics, financial engineering, mathematics or science and/or MBA, along with 7+ years of related experience
  • Solid understanding of financial principles, pricing models, financial engineering, econometrics and risk metrics
  • Strong grasp of the Asset Liability Management discipline
  • Strong understanding of the balance sheet dynamics including products characteristics, consumer behaviour and balance sheet flows
  • Strong communication skill

Nice to Have

  • CFA, FRM preferred
  • QRM experience beneficial

Job Summary

This position is responsible for research and analytics related to market risk, pricing models (diffusion models, term structure, historic simulation and factor models) and client behaviour (redemption / prepayment / term and product preference, volume projections) in support of non-trading balance sheet and mortgage pipeline risk measurement, pricing, and forecast simulation. The position supports effective and proactive management of interest rate risk for domestic and global retail and business banking balance sheets.

The role requires a thorough understanding of the risk and liquidity characteristics of retail and business banking products along with ALM hedging instruments.

This position also supports RBC Pension Investment group with risk modeling and measurement for Canadian and International DB pension plans

  • Define testing scope and methodology using a risk-based approach against data sets/portfolios, data sources/systems, reporting elements, and data infrastructure components

The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, accountable for managing the firm’s information management risk in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives. item.description:

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Credit Risk Modeling and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Senior Manager, Credit Risk Modeling and Analytics will be reporting to the Director, Credit Risk Modeling and Analytics. The ideal candidate will assist in the development, and management of a credit strategies calculation platform for Portfolio Management & Credit Strategies (PMCS).

In addition, this role is responsible for all internal risk management reporting and ad-hoc analysis of the portfolio, working in conjunction with finance and the broader P&CB teams. The employee in this role is accountable for ensuring efficient flow of information through the management ladder.

This role gives the opportunity to develop and build on strengths including strategic thought leadership, credit strategy design & analysis, connecting tactical plans to strategic roadmaps and the research and development process involved in assisting with new Personal Lending product introductions.

What will you do?

Development of credit strategies calculation platform

  • Assist in the development and management aspects associated with the implementation and maintenance of an Portfolio Management and Credit Strategies calculation platform
  • Plan, build and maintain PCL forecast engine for financial statements projection
  • End-to-end project management, continuous interaction with key stakeholders (strategy, implementation, business and model validation partners)
  • Support the implementation of strategies
  • Proactively identify risks and vulnerabilities to guide future model implementation,

Management and Financial reporting and analysis

  • Assist with specification and development of analyses.
  • Perform ah-hoc analyses and analyze results for communication to senior management, with focus on business and risk implications.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Excellent process management, communication, and coordination skills.
  • High level experience in data manipulation on large datasets (ingestion, processing, merging and aggregation of data)

Nice-to-Have:

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics is responsible for conducting the independent validation over the accuracy and integrity of data throughout the data supply chain that supports the firm’s key business processes such as regulatory reporting and critical management reporting.  This entails performing data analysis and transaction testing using analytical tools to address key risks associated with the data sets and data infrastructure.

The Senior Manager position is an individual contributor role within the Data Quality Assurance & Analytics function of the Enterprise Data Governance Operations (EDGO) of the Chief Data Office (CDO). The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, accountable for managing the firm’s information management risk in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives.  The Senior Manager position reports to the Director of Data Quality Assurance & Analytics.

What will you do?

  • Define testing scope and methodology using a risk-based approach against data sets/portfolios, data sources/systems, reporting elements, and data infrastructure components
  • Engage with stakeholders to gather information required in defining testing cycles and engagement model 
  • Create repeatable documented test scripts and maintain them accordingly
  • Define data testing automation requirements and engage with technology partners for tool selection and use
  • Document data testing procedures and controls including identifying the entrance and exit criteria of key processes and classifying risk and controls accordingly as well as reporting self-identified findings and remediating them
  • Execute data testing procedures and test scripts including identifying root cause of issues and grouping them into themes
  • Produce test results memo including clearly articulating test results, summarizing key findings and issues and communicate the data testing story to stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to solicit their remediation plans and validate that remediation plans are sustainable
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and optimize the data quality assurance processes including recommending analytical tools and training courses
  • Contributes content for the development of training materials
  • Conduct knowledge sharing sessions amongst staff within the Enterprise Chief Data Office and participate in key events and meetings
  • Promote the value of data quality assurance & analytics services to key stakeholders across the bank and establish strong and trusted relationships
  • Prepare and contribute materials required for regulatory and internal audit exams as required Escalate operational risks and issues and control deficiencies that you identify in your line of work to your line manager on a timely basis

What do you need to succeed?

  • 10+ years of progressive experience performing and managing data quality risks and controls in the financial services or other regulated industry
  • Significant knowledge of banking and trading data including front-to-back data flows and processing, usage and reporting
  • Significant knowledge of banking rules and regulations such as BCBS 239, US GAAP, Sarbanes Oxley, FBO  regulatory reporting, OCC Heightened Standards
  • Proficient in data analysis and data testing including working experience in using data analytical tools
  • Proficient in project management including participating in large scale data initiatives
  • Strong interviewing, facilitation, collaboration and relationship management skills
  • Excellent communication (both written and verbal) skills
  • Undergraduate or Graduate Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field

Must have:

  • Knowledge of data governance and data management operations such as critical data elements, data lineage, data accuracy and completeness and data controls
  • Broad understanding of information management risk
  • Flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities and identify impact to existing work
  • Understanding of technical data concepts such as data ingestion, data warehouse, data lakes, master reference data, data models, systems of record, aggregation layer and reporting systems

Nice to have:

  • Accounting or Finance degree with public accounting experience is a plus
  • Working experience using technical tools in the areas of data analysis such as SQL, data profiling, and data visualization

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Hybrid work arrangement with a combination of working remotely and in an office environment
  • Normal office working hours with occasional need to work extra hours to address regulatory requirements or hold meetings with other RBC colleagues in different time zones
  • Frequent expenditure of mental effort resulting from activities such as detailed data analysis and testing and/or preparation of senior management presentations and reports
  • Very little physical effort required

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater responsibilities

item.title: Project Manager - Cash Analytics Live & Batch Service
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Project Manager - Cash Analytics Live & Batch Service

Job Description

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

The Cash Analytics team is undertaking multiple capital market wide initiatives to handle central risk, pricing and analytics for cash products. The senior project manager will be responsible for the End to End execution of the Cash Analytics Service Batch build up with initial focus to take over Risk Watch EOD batch dev group. Long term, this role will also be supporting several other projects, working directly with the Portfolio Manager in executing/managing the Cash Analytics Live and Batch Service portfolio.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Work directly with the IT teams (developers, QA, BA’s) and help drive execution of the deliverables

  • Work with the respective technology teams to develop and manage a detailed project schedule and work plan

  • Monitor progress and make adjustments as needed

  • Provide project updates on a consistent basis to lead PMO, ensuring that reporting to exec level are up to date and escalations raised at appropriate times.

  • Understand complexity of a situation/status and translate it into an executive level summary

  • Ensure project tracking systems (i.e. JIRA, GAP), are up to date

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to drive the vision and lead two growing and successful Data Service products: Galileo and PATH. 

Galileo is a self-serve, one-stop "Storefront" to empower the organization with access to data, tools and processes without the dependency on heavy IT support/involvement.  PATH is a journey analytics platform that connects data points across systems and channels to uncover opportunities to improve client experience and operational efficiency.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Architecture/ product teams/ user experience and design specialists to ensure product architecture/ design principles/ standards are in place to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s) while ensuring easy access and ease of use.

Must-have

item.title: Director, Data Management & Engineering
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Data Management & Engineering

Job Description

What is the Opportunity? 


This is a leadership opportunity for someone with a proven track record in data management/engineering as well as building and leading high-performing teams. You’ll be responsible for driving the transformation and modernization of RBC Global Procurement data management, data storage and other business intelligence systems. This role will require the candidate to establish and foster strong, collaborative relationships with senior leaders and teams across the bank and continuously look for new opportunities to automate processes and new analytics approaches and tools

As part of the Global Procurement Solutions & Services (GPSS) team, this role will provide strategic direction for the management, governance and enhancement of:
• The data as it relates to the procurement solutions, third party expense management solutions and relevant enterprise data
• The Datamart, and all data feeds and related processes
• The business intelligence tools used to drive analytics and insights from the relevant data.

What will you do? 

  • This role will be responsible for improving, and governing the Global Procurement Datamart and data feeds from source systems
  • Partner with key stakeholders to drive data strategy, to understand data requirements and to continuously improve data offerings through automation and application tools.
  • Design and manage data and governance strategy to keep pace with the changing data sources and oversee integration with enterprise systems
  • Lead delivery of changes to our data feeds and processes with the team as well as design automation opportunities with the product owners
  • Participate in enterprise projects that impact our source feeds into the data mart and collaborate with key stakeholders across the enterprise to ensure the right expertise
  • Oversee Procurement database architecture to meet an audience with varying technical proficiency; develop and maintain a simplified delivery model where stakeholder can make data driven decisions. Monitors the data model design and optimization; leads database architects to conduct development, testing and validation processes to meet organizational requirements.
  • Provide expertise and coaching to team members on coding related to data engineering.
  • Lead the integration and optimization of structured and/or unstructured data through the use of database tools, technologies and methods

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have  

  • University Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Business Intelligence or related field
  • 5+ years demonstrated technical expertise and experience leading a team in data architecture, data management and data analytics.
  • Strong coding experience in SQL and data analytics tools (i.e. SAS, R, Python, Tableau); with the ability to coach team members.
  • Strong analytical, business communication and presentation skills with demonstrated stakeholder management and influencing skills
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to conceptualize strategy.
  • Proven ability in driving and influencing organizational and technical change through innovation and current technologies
  • Experience in people leadership

Nice to have

  • Master’s degree in business or quantitative discipline
  • Knowledge of RBC Data environment

What’s in it for you?  

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Lead a high performing team.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Solution Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst / Data Solution Architect

Job Description

Data Analytics and Consolidation Services

  • Support RBC enterprise wide client and credit information consolidation and analytics based on Enterprise Business Registry (EBR) functions.
  • Provide day to day reference data services (initiatives and inquiries) for EBR consumers i.e. Enterprise Risk Reporting, Capital Measurement, Large Exposure Framework (LEF) reporting and IFRS9.
  • Build the data controls for critical reference data elements that EBR owns the derivation and precedence rules.
  • Build the data controls and attestations for reference data that EBR published and exception reports.
  • Regularly monitor the exception reports and attestation results to assess the impact to EBR data consumers.
  • Support the review and challenge of the data assessment from RBC finance and risk data second line of defense units for EBR perspective.
  • Support the data quality investigation and remediation action from Finance and Risk Data Management Office.
  • Maintain the proof of records for Initiatives, Investigation, Challenges, and Data Audits from various RBC data policy and control units from EBR perspective.

Reference Data and Rules Management

  • Maintain and document the enterprise critical Credit Risk Data Element derivation and precedence rules with Risk and Finance stakeholders (i.e. business owners from Credit Risk, Finance and Capital Measurement, Risk Models and Parameter Estimation, Risk and Finance Reporting adjudicators etc.)
  • Engage the enterprise stakeholders and manage the rule reviews.
  • Manage the reference data rule inquiries and investigations with stakeholders and data consumers.
  • Oversight the quality of critical Credit Risk Data Elements and data issue reporting impacts for areas including Enterprise Risk Reporting (ERR), Wholesale Portfolio Management (WCPM), Wholesale Credit Risk (WCR), Special Loan (SL), Wholesale Parameter Estimation, Finance and Risk Capital.
  • Execute the data controls and attestations to assess the effectiveness of Credit Risk Reference Data and relevant reporting process impact.
  • Report impact and assist in possible solutions for data defects and remediation.
  • Advise on reference data risk control adjudications.
  • Manage the coordination and reviews for remediation activities with Finance and Risk Data Management and Operations
  • Support regulatory reviews, audit inquiries, self-assessments and exams as appropriate.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Credit Risk and/or Finance Management: Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in any area among Credit Risk management, modelling or reporting in the areas of Wholesale/Retail Credit Risk, Wholesale Portfolio Management and Risk Reporting, Capital and Finance calculation and reporting, etc.
  • Data Analytics and Business Data Requirement: Proven experience as a senior data analyst. Ability to independently query databases, consolidates data, automate the data collection, conduct analysis, review logic and business rules. Supply explicit business data requirement for IT counterparts.
  • Data Quality Management:  Ability to design and execute appropriate scenarios, tests and analytical approaches to validate the quality of data and reports, test the effectiveness of data controls.
  • Communication: Effective written and oral communications skills to explain concepts, structure content and proven ability to communicate to different levels.
  • Problem Solving: Creative thinking to support or advise the development of creative solutions.
  • Agile, Structured Thinking & Critical Reasoning:  Ability to adapt quickly and learn and innovate while dealing with ambiguity and unknowns by creating structure to reach solutions.
  • Collaboration: Ability to engage and collaborate with medium to large groups of counterparts and audience.
  • Networking: Ability to build and utilize internal networks

Nice to Have:

  • Assurance and/or management consulting experience are a plus.
  • Analytical and modelling experience is a plus.
  • Tableau development experience is a great asset.
  • Credit Risk report preparation experience is a plus.
  • Understanding of major risk/finance regulatory requirements and/or BCBS 239 Principles.
  • Knowledge of RBC’s finance/risk systems infrastructure and data architecture is a plus.
  • Graduate degree in business or related discipline and/or MBA, or other professional related qualification.
  • Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in data quality related activities. 

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Manage the Enterprise Reference Data analytics and Data solutions from financial institution’s Risk and Finance perspective. Assist in establishment and execution of Reference Data Management Framework and Data Controls to safeguard the reference data published to RBC Risk and Finance reporting units. Provide day to day service to enterprise consumers and stakeholders of reference data consumed and published. Manage the reference data precedence rule and reviews with stakeholders. Manage the reference data consumption and sourcing improvement and development based on regulatory and consumer/provider initiatives.

item.title: Director Credit Modeling and Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director Credit Modeling and Methodology

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data infrastructure perspective.

You will focus on leading a team building out the infrastructure for data ingested for modeling Wholesale parameters: PD, LGD and EAD monitoring and development. You will assist the Senior Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a strong high-performing leader to become a key partner on the data side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. Given the nature of our work, the opportunity to learn, grow and expand your network is significant. 

What will you do?

  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Wholesale processes and credit risk data used at RBC

  • Lead a team of qualified subject matter experts in all manner of data analytics

  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization

  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to

  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies

  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong leadership capabilities to provide mentorship to a team of data analytics professionals

  • Wholesale credit risk modeling knowledge and lending products data acumen

  • Strong data manipulation capability with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS, Python or similar tools

  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights

  • At least 5 years working experience with lending products and related databases

  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with relational databases and data visualization tools

 Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis

  • Experience in the Financial industry

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment

  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program

  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching

  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Job Summary

Lead the team responsible for data infrastructure used in Wholesale Parameter Estimation, a process that generates ~$200bn RWA. Accountable for the analysis and oversight of the data behind Wholesale parameters.

item.title: Manager, CRM Data Enablement and Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CRM Data Enablement and Reporting

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Are you a highly technical person with strong business acumen and extensive expertise in data systems and processes?  If so we want to hear from you.   RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, CRM Data Enablement and Reporting.  In this role you will work directly with partners in Marketing, Product, Client Interaction and Decision Management to fulfill the following critical roles:

1) Development and delivery of CRM related reporting solutions required for Personal and Commercial Banking to meet business and financial imperatives

2) Identification and implementation of data, process and infrastructure enhancements to ensure RBC CRM and marketing reporting capabilities meet best-in-class standards

What will you do?

  • Development of trigger campaign and client treatment plan related dashboards across line of business within Personal and Commercial Banking using Tableau
  • By leveraging data from Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) as well as Enterprise Data Lake (EDL), develop and prepare reporting datasets and tables using analytical tool such as SAS
  • Collaborate with business partners to ensure all reporting is developed to meet requirements and is delivered with accuracy and on time
  • Work closely with Marketing Analytics team to ensure campaign measurement metrics are captured and delivered
  • Evolve and optimize reporting infrastructure and ensure alignment to strategic objectives.
  • Review existing reporting processes and capabilities to identify and recommend continuous improvement opportunities and efficiencies
  • Collaborate with IT partners to impact, influence and adopt new reporting technologies to better enable self-serve reporting functions
  • Automation of reporting process using Stonebranch and/or UNIX batch process

What you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Ability to perform data analysis and manipulation using SAS (Base SAS 9.4/Enterprise guide/SAS Studio)
  • Advanced proficiency in developing user friendly reports and dashboards using Tableau
  • Superior and proven technical experience with large relational databases (i.e. Teradata/DB2)
  • Proven experience in report automation

item.title: Associate Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology

Job Description

The Associate Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Retail and Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters. 

You will focus on model development, back-testing and the quality of data ingested for modeling credit risk parameters, PD, LGD and EAD. You will assist the Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters. 

The team has significant impact across the bank and continuous interactions with other groups and stakeholders, including Senior Management and regulators.

What will you do?

  • Participate in design sessions to provide input, gather and document requirements, and help formulate analytical frameworks to develop effective risk model reporting that creates robust business intelligence
  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Quarterly Monitoring and regulatory reporting processes and data
  • Lead, as a subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities (activities include, but are not limited to data analysis, aggregation, interpretation and recommendation)
  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization
  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to
  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies
  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

 What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong business and data acumen
  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights
  • At least 3 years working experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data
  • Advanced SQL programming and experience in SAS or similar tools; expertise with MS Office Suite.
  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with data management and data visualization using tools including Tableau
  • Strong data manipulation capability using financial formulas

 Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis
  • Experience in the Financial industry
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment
  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program
  • Leaders who support your development through training and coaching
  • Work with a dynamic, collaborative team with ability to make a difference

Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We employ approximately 78,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 39 other countries. item.description:

Job Title

Senior Data Engineer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC (Barbados) Service Company Limited has a vacancy for a Senior Data Engineer.  You will have responsibility for providing business intelligence (leveraging software and services to transform source data into actionable information) at a senior level by using a systematic approach to plan, create, and maintain data architectures while also keeping it aligned with RBC Insurance Company Limited business requirements.

What will you do?

  • Act as the Centre of Expertise in all manner of product-centric data mining activities including reporting, data analysis, aggregation and management while ensuring compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to
  • Act as strategic partner with Business Partners and help guide them on matters of industry, best business practices, and technology strategies 
  • Develop code, ensure code is reviewed and tested and provide review of coding of junior team members.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best in class standard reports and dashboards to showcase insights and support tactics, including exploration and learning new technologies and systems
  • Responsible for the design, development and management of regular production and ad-hoc data-mining and reporting requests of high to medium complexity (e.g. single source-system requests, writing code).
  • Develop the Extract Transform and Load process and database objects used to load data from source systems into staging tables and transforms data in data mart structures
  • Responsible for constructing and maintaining data architectures and production schedules as senior member of the team
  • Manage the storage of data and access to the data and lead efforts to pinpoint tasks where manual participation can be eliminated with automation

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, or a discipline that develops capability in data mining, analytics and reporting
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience working with financial products/services and corresponding data
  • Solid working experience with very large relational databases and large volumes of data of various formats and MS Office Professional Suite with emphasis on C#, Visual Basic or Visual Basic for Applications
  • Advanced SAS, Apache Spark, MapReduce, Oracle Data, SQL, Python, R, VBA, JCL, SAS, GDG, JTS
  • SQL programming demonstrating the use of efficient querying/datamining techniques

item.title: Manager, Enterprise Model Risk Management, Market & Counterparty Credit Risk
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Enterprise Model Risk Management, Market & Counterparty Credit Risk

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Manager, you will validate counterparty and funding valuation adjustment and other XVA models used for financial and risk reporting for RBC trading activities. Your responsibilities include preventing any loss that could occur due to the misuse of mathematically complex models, for the purpose of protecting and enhancing RBC’s financial safety and reputation. As Manager, you will enhance RBC’s knowledge capital and increase the bank’s operational effectiveness in dealing with a large volume of regulatory-driven model validation initiatives.  You will contribute to RBC’s goal of being a leading financial services partner valued for our expertise.

What will you do?

  • Independently validate (replicate, benchmark, and/or backtest, as applicable) new and existing pricing and risk measurement models for RBC Capital Markets with a concentration on valuation adjustments (XVA).

  • Identify and escalate material issues related to model risk, and provide consultancy to business model users/owners with respect to potential solutions to those issues.

  • Assist Local Market Risk, Product Control and Valuations, and other model stakeholders to monitor and assess the ongoing performance of models and to ensure adherence to model usage restrictions/limitations.

  • Perform report writing, annual model assessments, and model inventory maintenance.

  • Acquire and maintain a thorough understanding of the flow and context of model usage by the business.

  • Engage model developers and related functional group personnel as necessary in order to proactively assess, document, and independently validate mathematical models and their usage by the bank.

  • Keep abreast of latest developments in derivatives pricing and risk modeling.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Graduate degree in quantitative areas, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, and Economics

  • Fluency in computational techniques, including Monte Carlo simulation for stochastic differential equations and expectation calculation, and finite difference method for solving partial differential equations.

  • Strong programming skills, proficiency in at least one high-level (Python preferred) and/or one lower-level (C++ or C# preferred)

  • Exposure to and good knowledge of quantitative financial models, including derivative pricing models, risk and capital models

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills

Nice-to-have    

  • Work experience in quantitative finance modeling or a related position

  • FRM or PRM certification, CFA Charter Holder

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities      

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

item.description:

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.
