Job Title

Director, Loss Mitigation

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Director, Loss Mitigation, you are responsible for the development, implementation, and monitoring of the Loss Mitigation (Triage & Collection) strategy and activity for the Canadian lending portfolio. The role requires liaising with the Operations team as well as the modeling team to develop cost optimized Collections strategies and implement them as well as lead a team in developing strategies that optimizing the balance between risk, reward and operational efficiency. You are accountable to the Senior Director for the successful achievement of goals and objectives within the assigned team.

What will you do?

  • Develop Collections & Triage strategy for multiple retail products as well as Business products leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning techniques
  • Performance monitoring and reporting for relevant customer segments, enabling actionable insight for key stakeholders, including Group Risk Management
  • Lead end-to-end stakeholders meetings with senior management in Group Risk Management, Products and Collection to:
    • understand and propose new strategies designed to help achieve business targets.
    • obtain approval of credit strategies with concise rationale supported by comprehensive analysis and documentation
  • Recommend opportunities and drive initiatives that will enhance portfolio performance or improve existing processes
  • Work with Implementation Team (TRIAD/PROBE) to ensure changes are exhaustively tested.
  • Support new strategy development with advanced analytics.
  • Cross-functional stakeholder management of Operations and GRM teams.
  • Monitor any changes in portfolio Risk to pre-empt stress to Collections.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Minimum 7 years’ experience with performing advanced analytics for lending products, ideally in portfolio management or collections.
  • Strong knowledge of data analysis tools such as SAS, SQL, Python/R
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Demonstrated track record of thought leadership.
  • Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate a compelling business case to business partners.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate - Market Data Solutions

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This position supports the market data needs for RBC Financial Group globally, including providing solutions and reviewing existing tools (and their associated costs). Market data provides the tools for revenue generation in multiple RBC businesses. For most RBC Enterprise businesses, market data is a critical dependency for revenue generation. Business partners are a demanding group of investment and risk management professionals who depend on timely and accurate market information for effective decision making. The role requires an astute business advisor and diplomat who understands not only the data, but also the business lines being served.

What will you do?

Contract Management

  • Become the global Market Data relationship manager, managing market data related contracts and negotiating best terms during contract reviews/new initiatives with savings and cost avoidance in mind.

Business Engagement

  • Become the key stakeholder to the global RBC Market Data user community, supporting all  platforms on their Market data requirements
  • Collaborate with various internal RBC groups and peers to identify improvements or alternative approaches, and provide leadership on best practices and options on Market Data services

Supplier Management/Vendor Engagement

  • Engage with market data suppliers on a regular basis to review market data requirements, issues, changes, updates, etc.
  • Coordinate meetings or be an escalation point for Market Data Suppliers and the RBC Stakeholders
  • Ensure all market data suppliers adhere to internal supplier management and business continuity requirements; also ensuring all documents and related internal systems are updated accordingly; can involve working with various internal groups (ie Legal, Finance, Functions, etc)

Analytics/Reporting

  • Produce ad-hoc, monthly and quarterly detailed reporting/presentation decks with valued added commentary, analysis and metrics point of escalation/reference for the business line problems

Product Research/Industry Intelligence

  • Seek out sources and solutions for market data strategy per RBC business requirements
  • Research industry trends and provide guidance on alternative solutions or changes impacting market data. Participate in industry working groups to lobby for consistent policies across data provider community
  • Evaluate and review new market data products and providing recommendations on services or solutions for RBC Enterprise

What you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 5+ years’ experience in a technology/financial services environment

Job Title

Senior Officer, Data Management (Fixed Term Contract)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

During this 12 month fixed term contract you will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained
  • Assist with Data Management tasks and projects as directed by Senior Associates, Manager of the Data Management team and the Manager of Data Standards & Control.
  • Collaborate with colleagues to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner
  • Assist with the timely completion of Data Remediation projects.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication skills
  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude
  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues
  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements
  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery
  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation
  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter

Nice-to-have

  • An understanding of client structures, primarily companies and trusts
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office products — specifically Word and Excel
  • Knowledge and understanding of Salesforce, RIBS, Milvus, Triple A, 5 Series, and Content Navigator

item.title: Manager, Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting

Job Description

Manager, Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting – Corporate Citizenship

PL08

What is the opportunity?

As Manager, Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting you will protect and enhance RBC’s position and brand as a leader in corporate citizenship through sustainability reporting, and building strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. Reporting to the Director, Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting, you will be part of a highly respected Corporate Citizenship team and act as ambassador for RBC on ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) reporting. This is an opportunity to join the Enterprise Sustainability & ESG team of Canada’s largest company, frequently ranked as one of the top companies to work for in Canada. The Enterprise ESG Performance & Reporting function serves a critical role in telling the story of RBC’s ESG performance to the public through the annual ESG Performance Report, Policy & Program Background Reports, Public Accountability Statement, and other external disclosures and survey responses to priority ESG rating indexes. This role will drive collaboration with stakeholders from across the organization to support effective and consistent external reporting in the ESG space, and will have a leadership role in ESG-related advocacy efforts as well as progressing an enterprise-wide project to evolve our ESG disclosure approach and strategy.

What will you do? 

  • Support the compilation and drafting of RBC’s reporting and disclosures on its sustainability strategy and performance, covering key Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) topics
  • Support survey responses to priority ESG rating indexes such as MSCI, Sustainalytics, DJSI, FTSE4Good and others
  • Proactively build relationships on sustainability reporting with key internal business partners as major content owners
  • Develop educational materials for internal and external stakeholders related to sustainability reporting, disclosure and trends
  • Conduct peer benchmarking and proactively monitor, assess, and evaluate impact of ESG-related standards and trends to derive insights to appropriately inform the reporting strategy and drive best-in-class ESG disclosures. Share findings, insights and education material with the enterprise
  • Identify and proactively manage sustainability reporting trends and drive performance insights, with action-oriented recommendations
  • Support proactive engagement with key stakeholders on sustainability issues, commitments, positions, partnerships and sponsorships of conferences in the sustainability space
  • Progress an enterprise-wide project to evolve our ESG disclosure approach and strategy. Collaborating with key enterprise partners to drive:
    • The advancement of the reporting strategy (reviewing scope, purpose, structure and synergies across adjacent reports at parent and subsidiary level) recommending fit-for-purpose governance, controls and processes around substantive ESG data and metrics
    • The design of the enterprise operating reporting model, including roles and responsibilities and engagement model across stakeholders (top down and bottom up)
    • The external stakeholder engagement model (e.g. rating agencies, partners, sponsors)
    • The review of our results from rating agencies and identify areas for enhancement, working closely with internal partners to collaborate on the action plan

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in finance, business or sustainability designation
  • 4+ years of experience in sustainability reporting and disclosure experience with preference for experience in a financial institution

  • Strong project management and coordination skills for report compilation
  • Experience in effectively communicating and engaging with a wide-range of stakeholders that may have opposing or differing views on sustainability topics
  • Understanding of relevant ESG reporting and disclosure expectations and trends
  • Strong understanding of ESG-related frameworks such as SASB, GRI, TCFD, etc. and relevant ESG reporting and disclosure expectations and trends, including evolving standards from ISSB
  • Demonstrated passion and interest in driving environmental and social change through business
  • Strong organizational, critical thinking; including ability to recommend practical solutions to complex challenges in a dynamic environment
  • Self-starter – enthusiasm and willingness to learn and stay abreast of constantly evolving developments
  • Detail oriented

Strongly Preferred

  • Chartered Professional Accountant designation
  • Strong understanding of regulatory disclosure requirements
  • Solid understanding of financial institutions, including all facets of RBC’s business and other activities with strong business acumen

Nice-to-have 

  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills to interact across all levels of the organization with impact and influence

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to do varied and intellectually challenging work and gain exposure to a wide range of stakeholders across the enterprise
  • Opportunity to own an end-to-end process and drive positive change through your leadership
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders and mentors who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Learning opportunities to help you sharpen your skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world

JOB SUMMARY
City:  Toronto
Address:  181 Bay Street
Work Hours/Week:  37.5
Work Environment:  Office
Employment Type:  Permanent
Career Level:  Experienced Hire/Professional
Pay Type:  Salary + Variable Bonus
Position Level:  PL08 
Required Travel(%):  0
Exempt/Non-Exempt:  N/A
People Manager:  No
